import enum
from dataclasses import dataclass
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Dict, Iterator, List, Optional, Tuple, Union

class ParameterKind(enum.Enum):
    """Enumeration for the different kinds of function parameters."""
    POSITIONAL_ONLY = "positional_only"
    POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD = "positional_or_keyword"
    VAR_POSITIONAL = "var_positional"
    KEYWORD_ONLY = "keyword_only"
    VAR_KEYWORD = "var_keyword"

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class Parameter:
    """Represents a function parameter with optional type annotation."""
    name: str
    kind: ParameterKind
    annotation: Optional[str] = None
    default: Optional[str] = None

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class Decorator:
    """Represents a function decorator."""
    name: str
    args: Tuple[str, ...] = ()

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class FunctionContext:
    """Represents the context where a function is defined."""
    pass

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class ModuleContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined at module level."""
    module_name: str

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class ClassContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined within a class."""
    class_name: str
    parent_context: FunctionContext

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class NestedContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined within another function."""
    parent_function: str
    parent_context: FunctionContext

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class FunctionInfo:
    """Complete metadata for a Python function."""
    name: str
    line_start: int
    line_end: int
    column_start: int
    column_end: int
    parameters: Tuple[Parameter, ...]
    decorators: Tuple[Decorator, ...]
    is_async: bool
    context: FunctionContext
    docstring: Optional[str] = None
    return_annotation: Optional[str] = None

def ast_node_to_source(node: ast.AST) -> str:
    """
    Convert an AST node back to its source code representation.

    Args:
        node: The AST node to convert.

    Returns:
        The source code string for the node, or a repr for fallback.
    """
    try:
        return ast.unparse(node)
    except Exception:
        return repr(node)

def extract_decorators(decorators: List[ast.expr]) -> Tuple[Decorator, ...]:
    """
    Extract decorator information from an AST decorator list.

    Args:
        decorators: A list of decorator nodes from an AST function definition.

    Returns:
        A tuple of Decorator objects.
    """
    def parse_decorator(dec: ast.expr) -> Decorator:
        if isinstance(dec, ast.Name):
            return Decorator(name=dec.id)
        if isinstance(dec, ast.Call):
            name = dec.func.id if isinstance(dec.func, ast.Name) else ast_node_to_source(dec.func)
            args = tuple(ast_node_to_source(arg) for arg in dec.args)
            return Decorator(name=name, args=args)
        return Decorator(name=ast_node_to_source(dec))

    return tuple(parse_decorator(dec) for dec in decorators)

def _extract_positional_only_params(args: ast.arguments, defaults_start_index: int) -> List[Parameter]:
    """Extracts positional-only parameters from an ast.arguments object."""
    params = []
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.posonlyargs):
        default = None
        if i >= defaults_start_index:
            default_index = i - defaults_start_index
            default = ast_node_to_source(args.defaults[default_index])
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY
        ))
    return params

def _extract_regular_params(args: ast.arguments, defaults_start_index: int) -> List[Parameter]:
    """Extracts regular (positional-or-keyword) parameters."""
    params = []
    posonly_count = len(args.posonlyargs)
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.args):
        default = None
        combined_index = posonly_count + i
        if combined_index >= defaults_start_index:
            default_index = combined_index - defaults_start_index
            default = ast_node_to_source(args.defaults[default_index])
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD
        ))
    return params

def _extract_var_positional_param(args: ast.arguments) -> List[Parameter]:
    """Extracts the variadic positional parameter (*args)."""
    if not args.vararg:
        return []
    return [Parameter(
        name=args.vararg.arg,
        annotation=ast_node_to_source(args.vararg.annotation) if args.vararg.annotation else None,
        kind=ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL
    )]

def _extract_keyword_only_params(args: ast.arguments) -> List[Parameter]:
    """Extracts keyword-only parameters."""
    params = []
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.kwonlyargs):
        default_node = args.kw_defaults[i]
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=ast_node_to_source(default_node) if default_node is not None else None,
            kind=ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY
        ))
    return params

def _extract_var_keyword_param(args: ast.arguments) -> List[Parameter]:
    """Extracts the variadic keyword parameter (**kwargs)."""
    if not args.kwarg:
        return []
    return [Parameter(
        name=args.kwarg.arg,
        annotation=ast_node_to_source(args.kwarg.annotation) if args.kwarg.annotation else None,
        kind=ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD
    )]

def extract_parameters(func_node: Union[ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef]) -> Tuple[Parameter, ...]:
    """
    Extract parameter information from a function's AST node.

    Args:
        func_node: The function definition node from the AST.

    Returns:
        A tuple of Parameter objects representing the function's signature.
    """
    args = func_node.args
    num_all_positional = len(args.posonlyargs) + len(args.args)
    defaults_start_index = num_all_positional - len(args.defaults)

    params: List[Parameter] = []
    params.extend(_extract_positional_only_params(args, defaults_start_index))
    params.extend(_extract_regular_params(args, defaults_start_index))
    params.extend(_extract_var_positional_param(args))
    params.extend(_extract_keyword_only_params(args))
    params.extend(_extract_var_keyword_param(args))
    return tuple(params)

def extract_docstring(func_node: Union[ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef]) -> Optional[str]:
    """
    Extract the docstring from a function node using a guard clause.

    Args:
        func_node: The function definition node from the AST.

    Returns:
        The docstring string, or None if not found.
    """
    if (not func_node.body or
            not isinstance(func_node.body[0], ast.Expr) or
            not isinstance(func_node.body[0].value, ast.Constant) or
            not isinstance(func_node.body[0].value.value, str)):
        return None
    return func_node.body[0].value.value

def visit_node(node: ast.AST, context: FunctionContext) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Recursively visit AST nodes and yield function information.

    Args:
        node: The current AST node to visit.
        context: The current context (Module, Class, or Nested).

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for each function found.
    """
    if isinstance(node, (ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef)):
        func_info = FunctionInfo(
            name=node.name,
            line_start=node.lineno,
            line_end=node.end_lineno or node.lineno,
            column_start=node.col_offset,
            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,
            parameters=extract_parameters(node),
            decorators=extract_decorators(node.decorator_list),
            is_async=isinstance(node, ast.AsyncFunctionDef),
            context=context,
            docstring=extract_docstring(node),
            return_annotation=ast_node_to_source(node.returns) if node.returns else None
        )
        yield func_info
        nested_context = NestedContext(parent_function=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from visit_node(child, nested_context)

    elif isinstance(node, ast.ClassDef):
        class_context = ClassContext(class_name=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from visit_node(child, class_context)
    else:
        for child in ast.iter_child_nodes(node):
            yield from visit_node(child, context)

def parse_python_file(file_path: Path) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python file and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        file_path: The path to the Python file.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the file.
    """
    with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
        source_code = f.read()
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=str(file_path))
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=file_path.stem)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))

def parse_python_source(source_code: str, module_name: str = "<string>") -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python source code string and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        source_code: The Python code to parse.
        module_name: The name to associate with the module.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the code.
    """
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=module_name)
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=module_name)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))

def filter_by_context(context_type: type, functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter functions by their context type (e.g., ClassContext).

    Args:
        context_type: The context class to filter by (e.g., ClassContext).
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects to filter.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the functions that match the context type.
    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if isinstance(f.context, context_type))

def filter_by_decorator(decorator_name: str, functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter functions that have a specific decorator.

    Args:
        decorator_name: The name of the decorator to search for.
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects to filter.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the functions that have the specified decorator.
    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if any(d.name == decorator_name for d in f.decorators))

def get_function_names(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[str, ...]:
    """
    Extract just the names from a sequence of functions.

    Args:
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects.

    Returns:
        A tuple of function name strings.
    """
    return tuple(f.name for f in functions)

def get_async_functions(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter for and return only the asynchronous functions.

    Args:
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the async functions.
    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if f.is_async)

def get_methods(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Get all functions defined within a class context (methods).

    Args:
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the functions defined in a ClassContext.
    """
    return filter_by_context(ClassContext, functions)

def format_function_signature(func: FunctionInfo) -> str:
    """
    Format a function's signature into a human-readable string.

    This function correctly handles positional-only, keyword-only, and
    variadic parameters.

    Args:
        func: The FunctionInfo object to format.

    Returns:
        A string representing the function's signature.
    """
    def format_param(p: Parameter) -> str:
        """Formats a single parameter object into a string."""
        res = p.name
        if p.annotation:
            res += f": {p.annotation}"
        if p.default is not None:
            res += f" = {p.default}"
        return res

    param_groups = []

    pos_only_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY)
    if pos_only_str:
        param_groups.append(pos_only_str)
        param_groups.append("/")

    pos_or_kw_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD)
    if pos_or_kw_str:
        param_groups.append(pos_or_kw_str)

    var_pos_str = next((f"*{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL), None)
    kw_only_params_exist = any(p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY for p in func.parameters)
    
    if var_pos_str:
        param_groups.append(var_pos_str)
    elif kw_only_params_exist:
        param_groups.append("*")

    kw_only_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY)
    if kw_only_str:
        param_groups.append(kw_only_str)

    var_kw_str = next((f"**{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD), None)
    if var_kw_str:
        param_groups.append(var_kw_str)

    params_str = ", ".join(g for g in param_groups if g)
    async_prefix = "async " if func.is_async else ""
    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""
    return f"{async_prefix}def {func.name}({params_str}){return_suffix}""}

class _FunctionVisitor:

        This method dispatches to more specific handlers based on node type.

        Args:

    """

    Args:

    Returns:

    """

    except Exception:

def extract_decorators(decorators: List[ast.expr]) -> Tuple[Decorator, ...]:

    Args:
        decorators: A list of decorator nodes from an AST function definition.

    Returns:
        A tuple of Decorator objects.
    """
    def parse_decorator(dec: ast.expr) -> Decorator:
        if isinstance(dec, ast.Name):
            return Decorator(name=dec.id)
        if isinstance(dec, ast.Call):
            name = dec.func.id if isinstance(dec.func, ast.Name) else ast_node_to_source(dec.func)
            args = tuple(ast_node_to_source(arg) for arg in dec.args)
            return Decorator(name=name, args=args)
        return Decorator(name=ast_node_to_source(dec))

    return tuple(parse_decorator(dec) for dec in decorators)

        default = None
        if i >= defaults_start_index:
            default_index = i - defaults_start_index
            default = ast_node_to_source(args.defaults[default_index])
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY
        ))
    return params

def _extract_regular_params(args: ast.arguments, defaults_start_index: int) -> List[Parameter]:
    """Extracts regular (positional-or-keyword) parameters."""
    params = []
    posonly_count = len(args.posonlyargs)
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.args):
        default = None
        combined_index = posonly_count + i
        if combined_index >= defaults_start_index:
            default_index = combined_index - defaults_start_index
            default = ast_node_to_source(args.defaults[default_index])

            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,

    return params

    if not args.vararg:

    params = []
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.kwonlyargs):

        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=ast_node_to_source(default_node) if default_node is not None else None,

    if (not func_node.body or

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for each function found.

        func_info = FunctionInfo(
            name=node.name,
            line_start=node.lineno,
            line_end=node.end_lineno or node.lineno,
            column_start=node.col_offset,
            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,
            parameters=extract_parameters(node),

            context=context,
            docstring=extract_docstring(node),
            return_annotation=ast_node_to_source(node.returns) if node.returns else None

            yield from visit_node(child, nested_context)

    """
    Parse a Python file and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        file_path: The path to the Python file.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the file.
    """
    with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
        source_code = f.read()
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=str(file_path))
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=file_path.stem)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))

def parse_python_source(source_code: str, module_name: str = "<string>") -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python source code string and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        source_code: The Python code to parse.
        module_name: The name to associate with the module.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the code.
    """
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=module_name)
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=module_name)

def format_function_signature(func: FunctionInfo) -> str:
    """
    Format a function's signature into a human-readable string.

    This function correctly handles positional-only, keyword-only, and
    variadic parameters.

    Args:
        func: The FunctionInfo object to format.

    Returns:
        A string representing the function's signature.
    """
    def format_param(p: Parameter) -> str:
        """Formats a single parameter object into a string."""
        res = p.name
        if p.annotation:
            res += f": {p.annotation}"
        if p.default is not None:
            res += f" = {p.default}"
        return res

    param_groups = []

    pos_only_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY)
    if pos_only_str:
        param_groups.append(pos_only_str)
        param_groups.append("/")

    pos_or_kw_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD)
    if pos_or_kw_str:
        param_groups.append(pos_or_kw_str)

    var_pos_str = next((f"*{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL), None)
    kw_only_params_exist = any(p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY for p in func.parameters)
    
    if var_pos_str:
        param_groups.append(var_pos_str)
    elif kw_only_params_exist:
        param_groups.append("*")

    kw_only_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY)
    if kw_only_str:
        param_groups.append(kw_only_str)

    var_kw_str = next((f"**{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD), None)
    if var_kw_str:
        param_groups.append(var_kw_str)

    params_str = ", ".join(g for g in param_groups if g)
    async_prefix = "async " if func.is_async else ""
    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""
    return f"{async_prefix}def {func.name}({params_str}){return_suffix}"

def extract_docstring(
    func_node: Union[ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef]
) -> Optional[str]:
    """
    Extract the docstring from a function node using the standard library.

    Args:
        func_node: The function definition node from the AST.

    Returns:
        The docstring string, or None if not found.
    """
    return ast.get_docstring(func_node)


def visit_node(node: ast.AST, context: FunctionContext) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Recursively visit AST nodes and yield function information.

    Args:
        node: The current AST node to visit.
        context: The current context (Module, Class, or Nested).

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for each function found.
    """
    if isinstance(node, (ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef)):
        func_info = FunctionInfo(
            name=node.name,
            line_start=node.lineno,
            line_end=node.end_lineno or node.lineno,
            column_start=node.col_offset,
            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,
            parameters=extract_parameters(node),
            decorators=extract_decorators(node.decorator_list),
            is_async=isinstance(node, ast.AsyncFunctionDef),
            context=context,
            docstring=extract_docstring(node),
            return_annotation=ast_node_to_source(node.returns) if node.returns else None,
        )
        yield func_info
        nested_context = NestedContext(parent_function=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from visit_node(child, nested_context)

    elif isinstance(node, ast.ClassDef):
        class_context = ClassContext(class_name=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:

def parse_python_file(file_path: Path) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python file and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        file_path: The path to the Python file.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the file.
    """
    with open(file_path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        source_code = f.read()
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=str(file_path))
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=file_path.stem)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))


def parse_python_source(
    source_code: str, module_name: str = "<string>"
) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python source code string and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        source_code: The Python code to parse.
        module_name: The name to associate with the module.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the code.
    """
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=module_name)
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=module_name)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))


def filter_by_context(
    context_type: Type[FunctionContext], functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]
) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter functions by their context type (e.g., ClassContext).

    Args:
        context_type: The context class to filter by (e.g., ClassContext).
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects to filter.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the functions that match the context type.
    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if isinstance(f.context, context_type))


def filter_by_decorator(
    decorator_name: str, functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]
) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter functions that have a specific decorator.

    Args:
        decorator_name: The name of the decorator to search for.
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects to filter.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the functions that have the specified decorator.
    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if any(d.name == decorator_name for d in f.decorators))


def get_function_names(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[str, ...]:
    """
    Extract just the names from a sequence of functions.

    Args:

    """
    return tuple(f.name for f in functions)


def get_async_functions(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter for and return only the asynchronous functions.

    Args:
        functions: A tuple of FunctionInfo objects.

    Returns:
        A new tuple containing only the async functions.
    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if f.is_async)


def get_methods(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Get all functions defined within a class context (methods).

    Args:

def format_function_signature(func: FunctionInfo) -> str:
    """
    Format a function's signature into a human-readable string.

    This function correctly handles positional-only, keyword-only, and
    variadic parameters by grouping them before formatting.

    Args:
        func: The FunctionInfo object to format.

    Returns:
        A string representing the function's signature.
    """
    def format_regular_param(p: Parameter) -> str:
        """Formats a single non-variadic parameter object into a string."""
        res = p.name
        if p.annotation:
            res += f": {p.annotation}"
        if p.default is not None:
            res += f" = {p.default}"
        return res

    grouped_params = defaultdict(list)
    for p in func.parameters:
        grouped_params[p.kind].append(p)

    param_parts = []

    if pos_only := grouped_params[ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY]:
        param_parts.append(", ".join(format_regular_param(p) for p in pos_only))
        param_parts.append("/")

    if pos_or_kw := grouped_params[ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD]:
        param_parts.append(", ".join(format_regular_param(p) for p in pos_or_kw))

    if var_pos := grouped_params[ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL]:
        p = var_pos[0]
        part = f"*{p.name}"
        if p.annotation:
            part += f": {p.annotation}"
        param_parts.append(part)
    elif grouped_params[ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY]:
        param_parts.append("*")

    if kw_only := grouped_params[ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY]:
        param_parts.append(", ".join(format_regular_param(p) for p in kw_only))

    if var_kw := grouped_params[ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD]:
        p = var_kw[0]
        part = f"**{p.name}"
        if p.annotation:
            part += f": {p.annotation}"
        param_parts.append(part)

    params_str = ", ".join(part for part in param_parts if part)
    async_prefix = "async " if func.is_async else ""
    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""
    return f"{async_prefix}def {func.name}({params_str}){return_suffix}"

class RefactoringEvaluator(dspy.Module):
    """A module to evaluate refactored code using programmatic checks and LLM judgment."""

    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.evaluator = dspy.Predict(EvaluationSignature)

    def forward(
        self, original_example: dspy.Example, prediction: dspy.Prediction, trace=None
    ) -> float:
        code = _extract_python_code(prediction.refactored_code)
        raw_tests = original_example.get("test_cases")
        tests = [TestCase(**tc) for tc in raw_tests] if raw_tests else []

        is_valid, func_name, _ = check_syntax(code)
        if not is_valid:
            return 0.0

        if not tests:  # Module refactoring
            quality = check_code_quality(code)
            functional_score = 1.0
        else:  # Function refactoring
            if not func_name:
                return 0.0
            quality = check_code_quality(code, func_name)
            passed_tests = check_functional_correctness(code, func_name, tests)
            functional_score = (passed_tests / len(tests)) if tests else 1.0

        eval_result = self.evaluator(
            code_snippet=code,
            quality_scores=quality.model_dump_json(),
            functional_score=functional_score,
        )
        try:
            return float(eval_result.final_score)
        except (ValueError, TypeError):
            return 0.0

class CodeRefactor(dspy.Module):
    """A module that analyzes, plans, and refactors Python code."""

    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.analyzer = dspy.Predict(CodeAnalysis)
        self.planner = dspy.Predict(RefactoringPlan)
        self.implementer = dspy.Predict(RefactoredCode)

    def forward(self, code_snippet: str) -> dspy.Prediction:
        analysis = self.analyzer(code_snippet=code_snippet)
        plan = self.planner(code_snippet=code_snippet, analysis=analysis.analysis)
        impl = self.implementer(
            original_code=code_snippet,
            refactoring_summary=plan.refactoring_summary,
            plan_steps=plan.plan_steps,
        )
        return dspy.Prediction(
            analysis=analysis.analysis,
            refactoring_opportunities=analysis.refactoring_opportunities,
            refactoring_summary=plan.refactoring_summary,
            plan_steps=plan.plan_steps,
            refactored_code=impl.refactored_code,
            implementation_explanation=impl.implementation_explanation,

class Parameter:
    """Represents a function parameter with optional type annotation."""
    name: str
    kind: ParameterKind
    annotation: Optional[str] = None
    default: Optional[str] = None


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class Decorator:
    """Represents a function decorator."""
    name: str
    args: Tuple[str, ...] = ()


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class FunctionContext:
    """Represents the context where a function is defined."""

class ModuleContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined at module level."""
    module_name: str


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class ClassContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined within a class."""
    class_name: str

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class NestedContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined within another function."""
    parent_function: str
    parent_context: FunctionContext


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class FunctionInfo:
    """Complete metadata for a Python function."""
    name: str

    line_end: int
    column_start: int
    column_end: int
    parameters: Tuple[Parameter, ...]

    Args:
        node: The AST node to convert.

    Returns:

    try:

    except Exception:

    Extract decorator information from an AST decorator list.

    Args:
        decorators: A list of decorator nodes from an AST function definition.

    Returns:
        A tuple of Decorator objects.

    def parse_decorator(dec: ast.expr) -> Decorator:

            name = ast_node_to_source(dec.func)

            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY

            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD
        ))

        params.append(Parameter(
            name=args.vararg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(args.vararg.annotation) if args.vararg.annotation else None,
            kind=ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL
        ))

    # Keyword-only parameters
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.kwonlyargs):
        default_node = args.kw_defaults[i]
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=ast_node_to_source(default_node) if default_node else None,
            kind=ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY
        ))

        params.append(Parameter(
            name=args.kwarg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(args.kwarg.annotation) if args.kwarg.annotation else None,

            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,

import ast
import enum
from dataclasses import dataclass
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Dict, Iterator, List, Optional, Tuple, Union


class ParameterKind(enum.Enum):
    """Enumeration for the different kinds of function parameters."""
    POSITIONAL_ONLY = "positional_only"
    POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD = "positional_or_keyword"
    VAR_POSITIONAL = "var_positional"
    KEYWORD_ONLY = "keyword_only"
    VAR_KEYWORD = "var_keyword"


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class Parameter:
    """Represents a function parameter with optional type annotation."""
    name: str
    kind: ParameterKind
    annotation: Optional[str] = None
    default: Optional[str] = None


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class Decorator:
    """Represents a function decorator."""
    name: str
    args: Tuple[str, ...] = ()


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class FunctionContext:
    """Represents the context where a function is defined."""

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class ModuleContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined at module level."""

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class ClassContext(FunctionContext):
    """Function defined within a class."""
    class_name: str
    parent_context: FunctionContext


@dataclass(frozen=True)
class NestedContext(FunctionContext):

@dataclass(frozen=True)
class FunctionInfo:

    line_end: int
    column_start: int
    column_end: int

def ast_node_to_source(node: ast.AST) -> str:
    """
    Convert an AST node back to its source code representation.

    Args:
        node: The AST node to convert.

    Returns:
        The source code string for the node, or a repr for fallback.
    """
    try:
        return ast.unparse(node)
    except Exception:
        return repr(node)


def extract_decorators(decorators: List[ast.expr]) -> Tuple[Decorator, ...]:
    """
    Extract decorator information from an AST decorator list.

    Args:
        decorators: A list of decorator nodes from an AST function definition.

    Returns:
        A tuple of Decorator objects.
    """
    def parse_decorator(dec: ast.expr) -> Decorator:
        if isinstance(dec, ast.Name):
            return Decorator(name=dec.id)
        if isinstance(dec, ast.Call):
            # Handles both simple names (e.g., @my_dec) and complex expressions
            # (e.g., @module.my_dec) uniformly.
            name = ast_node_to_source(dec.func)
            args = tuple(ast_node_to_source(arg) for arg in dec.args)
            return Decorator(name=name, args=args)
        return Decorator(name=ast_node_to_source(dec))

    return tuple(parse_decorator(dec) for dec in decorators)


def extract_parameters(
    func_node: Union[ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef]
) -> Tuple[Parameter, ...]:
    """
    Extract parameter information from a function's AST node.

    This function consolidates the logic for all parameter kinds, handling
    their respective default value rules and annotations.

    Args:
        func_node: The function definition node from the AST.

    Returns:
        A tuple of Parameter objects representing the function's signature.
    """
    params: List[Parameter] = []
    args = func_node.args

    # Defaults for positional-only and positional-or-keyword args are in one list.
    # We calculate an offset to correctly map defaults to their arguments.
    defaults_offset = len(args.posonlyargs) + len(args.args) - len(args.defaults)

    # Positional-only parameters
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.posonlyargs):
        default = None
        if i >= defaults_offset:
            default = ast_node_to_source(args.defaults[i - defaults_offset])
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY
        ))

    # Positional-or-keyword parameters
    for i, arg in enumerate(args.args):
        default = None
        default_index = i + len(args.posonlyargs) - defaults_offset
        if default_index >= 0:
            default = ast_node_to_source(args.defaults[default_index])
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD
        ))

    # Variadic positional parameter (*args)
    if args.vararg:
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=args.vararg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(args.vararg.annotation) if args.vararg.annotation else None,
            kind=ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL
        ))

    for i, arg in enumerate(args.kwonlyargs):
        default_node = args.kw_defaults[i]

            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=ast_node_to_source(default_node) if default_node else None,
            kind=ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY
        ))

    if args.kwarg:
        params.append(Parameter(
            name=args.kwarg.arg,

def visit_node(node: ast.AST, context: FunctionContext) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Recursively visit AST nodes and yield function information.

    Args:

        context: The current context (Module, Class, or Nested).

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for each function found.
    """
    if isinstance(node, (ast.FunctionDef, ast.AsyncFunctionDef)):
        func_info = FunctionInfo(
            name=node.name,
            line_start=node.lineno,
            line_end=node.end_lineno or node.lineno,
            column_start=node.col_offset,
            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,
            parameters=extract_parameters(node),
            decorators=extract_decorators(node.decorator_list),
            is_async=isinstance(node, ast.AsyncFunctionDef),
            context=context,
            docstring=ast.get_docstring(node, clean=False),
            return_annotation=ast_node_to_source(node.returns) if node.returns else None
        )
        yield func_info
        nested_context = NestedContext(parent_function=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from visit_node(child, nested_context)

    elif isinstance(node, ast.ClassDef):
        class_context = ClassContext(class_name=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from visit_node(child, class_context)
    else:
        for child in ast.iter_child_nodes(node):
            yield from visit_node(child, context)


def parse_python_file(file_path: Path) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python file and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        file_path: The path to the Python file.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the file.
    """
    with open(file_path, 'r', encoding='utf-8') as f:
        source_code = f.read()
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=str(file_path))
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=file_path.stem)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))


def parse_python_source(source_code: str, module_name: str = "<string>") -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Parse a Python source code string and extract all function definitions.

    Args:
        source_code: The Python code to parse.
        module_name: The name to associate with the module.

    Returns:
        A tuple of FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the code.
    """
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=module_name)
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=module_name)
    return tuple(visit_node(tree, module_context))

    return tuple(f for f in functions if isinstance(f.context, context_type))


def filter_by_decorator(
    decorator_name: str, functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]

    """
    Filter functions that have a specific decorator.

    Args:

    """

    Returns:

    return tuple(f.name for f in functions)


def get_async_functions(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:
    """
    Filter for and return only the asynchronous functions.

    Args:

    Returns:

    """
    return tuple(f for f in functions if f.is_async)


def get_methods(functions: Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]) -> Tuple[FunctionInfo, ...]:

def format_function_signature(func: FunctionInfo) -> str:
    """
    Format a function's signature into a human-readable string.

    Args:
        func: The FunctionInfo object to format.

    Returns:
        A string representing the function's signature.
    """
    def format_param(p: Parameter) -> str:
        """Formats a single parameter object into a string."""
        res = p.name
        if p.annotation:
            res += f": {p.annotation}"
        if p.default is not None:
            res += f" = {p.default}"
        return res

    pos_only_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY)
    if pos_only_str:
        param_groups.append(pos_only_str)

        param_groups.append("/")

    pos_or_kw_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD)
    if pos_or_kw_str:
        param_groups.append(pos_or_kw_str)

    var_pos_str = next((f"*{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL), None)
    kw_only_params_exist = any(p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY for p in func.parameters)
    
    if var_pos_str:
        param_groups.append(var_pos_str)
    elif kw_only_params_exist:
        # Add the keyword-only argument separator if there's no *args.
        param_groups.append("*")

    kw_only_str = ", ".join(format_param(p) for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY)
    if kw_only_str:
        param_groups.append(kw_only_str)

    var_kw_str = next((f"**{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD), None)
    if var_kw_str:
        param_groups.append(var_kw_str)

    params_str = ", ".join(g for g in param_groups if g)

    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""
    return f"{async_prefix}def {func.name}({params_str}){return_suffix}"

class RefactoringEvaluator(dspy.Module):
    """A module to evaluate refactored code using programmatic checks and LLM judgment."""

    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.evaluator = dspy.Predict(EvaluationSignature)

    def forward(
        self, original_example: dspy.Example, prediction: dspy.Prediction, trace=None
    ) -> float:
        code = _extract_python_code(prediction.refactored_code)
        raw_tests = original_example.get("test_cases")
        tests = [TestCase(**tc) for tc in raw_tests] if raw_tests else []

        is_valid, func_name, _ = check_syntax(code)
        if not is_valid:
            return 0.0

        if not tests:  # Module refactoring
            quality = check_code_quality(code)
            functional_score = 1.0
        else:  # Function refactoring
            if not func_name:
                return 0.0
            quality = check_code_quality(code, func_name)
            passed_tests = check_functional_correctness(code, func_name, tests)
            functional_score = (passed_tests / len(tests)) if tests else 1.0

        eval_result = self.evaluator(
            code_snippet=code,
            quality_scores=quality.model_dump_json(),
            functional_score=functional_score,
        )
        try:
            return float(eval_result.final_score)
        except (ValueError, TypeError):
            return 0.0

        is_valid, func_name, _ = check_syntax(code)
        if not is_valid:
            return 0.0

        if not tests:  # Module refactoring
            quality = check_code_quality(code)
            functional_score = 1.0
        else:  # Function refactoring

                return 0.0
            quality = check_code_quality(code, func_name)
            passed_tests = check_functional_correctness(code, func_name, tests)

            code_snippet=code,
            quality_scores=quality.model_dump_json(),
            functional_score=functional_score,
        )

            return float(eval_result.final_score)
        except (ValueError, TypeError):

class RefactoringEvaluator(dspy.Module):
    """A module to evaluate refactored code using programmatic checks and LLM judgment."""

    def __init__(self):
        super().__init__()
        self.evaluator = dspy.Predict(EvaluationSignature)

    def forward(
        self, original_example: dspy.Example, prediction: dspy.Prediction, trace=None
    ) -> float:
        code = _extract_python_code(prediction.refactored_code)
        raw_tests = original_example.get("test_cases")
        tests = [TestCase(**tc) for tc in raw_tests] if raw_tests else []

        is_valid, func_name, _ = check_syntax(code)
        if not is_valid:
            return 0.0

        if not tests:  # Module refactoring
            quality = check_code_quality(code)
            functional_score = 1.0
        else:  # Function refactoring
            if not func_name:
                return 0.0
            quality = check_code_quality(code, func_name)
            passed_tests = check_functional_correctness(code, func_name, tests)
            functional_score = (passed_tests / len(tests)) if tests else 1.0

        eval_result = self.evaluator(
            code_snippet=code,
            quality_scores=quality.model_dump_json(),
            functional_score=functional_score,
        )
        try:
            return float(eval_result.final_score)
        except (ValueError, TypeError):
            return 0.0

class _FunctionVisitor:
    """An AST visitor to find and yield all function definitions."""

    def visit(

        self, node: ast.FunctionDef | ast.AsyncFunctionDef, context: FunctionContext
    ) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
        """Handle FunctionDef and AsyncFunctionDef nodes."""
        func_info = FunctionInfo(
            name=node.name,
            line_start=node.lineno,
            line_end=node.end_lineno or node.lineno,
            column_start=node.col_offset,
            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,
            parameters=tuple(extract_parameters(node)),
            decorators=extract_decorators(node.decorator_list),

            context=context,
            docstring=extract_docstring(node),
            return_annotation=ast_node_to_source(node.returns) if node.returns else None,
        )
        yield func_info

        nested_context = NestedContext(parent_function=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from self.visit(child, nested_context)

        self, node: ast.ClassDef, context: FunctionContext
    ) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:

        class_context = ClassContext(class_name=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from self.visit(child, class_context)

def format_function_signature(func: FunctionInfo) -> str:
    """
    Format a function's signature into a human-readable string.

    Returns:

    def format_param(p: Parameter) -> str:
        """Formats a single parameter object into a string."""
        res = p.name
        if p.annotation:
            res += f": {p.annotation}"
        if p.default is not None:
            res += f" = {p.default}"
        return res

    parts = []
    pos_only = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY
    ]
    pos_or_kw = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD
    ]
    kw_only = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY
    ]
    var_pos = next(
        (f"*{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL),
        None,
    )
    var_kw = next(
        (f"**{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD),
        None,
    )

    if pos_only:
        parts.append(", ".join(pos_only))
        parts.append("/")
    if pos_or_kw:
        parts.append(", ".join(pos_or_kw))
    if var_pos:
        parts.append(var_pos)
    elif kw_only:
        parts.append("*")
    if kw_only:
        parts.append(", ".join(kw_only))
    if var_kw:
        parts.append(var_kw)

    params_str = ", ".join(part for part in parts if part)
    async_prefix = "async " if func.is_async else ""
    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""
    return f"{async_prefix}def {func.name}({params_str}){return_suffix}"

    line_start: int
    line_end: int
    column_start: int
    column_end: int
    parameters: tuple[Parameter, ...]

    Convert an AST node back to its source code representation.

    except Exception:

            name=arg.arg,
            annotation=ast_node_to_source(arg.annotation) if arg.annotation else None,
            default=default,
            kind=ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY,

    args: ast.arguments, defaults_start_index: int
) -> Iterator[Parameter]:

        self, node: ast.ClassDef, context: FunctionContext
    ) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:

        class_context = ClassContext(class_name=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:

    Args:
        file_path: The path to the Python file.

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the file.

    with open(file_path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        source_code = f.read()
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=str(file_path))
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=file_path.stem)
    visitor = _FunctionVisitor()
    yield from visitor.visit(tree, module_context)

        if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD

    kw_only = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY
    ]

        (f"*{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL),
        None,
    )
    var_kw = next(
        (f"**{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD),
        None,
    )

    if pos_only:
        parts.append(", ".join(pos_only))
        parts.append("/")
    if pos_or_kw:

    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""

            column_end=node.end_col_offset or node.col_offset,
            parameters=tuple(extract_parameters(node)),
            decorators=extract_decorators(node.decorator_list),
            is_async=isinstance(node, ast.AsyncFunctionDef),
            context=context,
            docstring=extract_docstring(node),
            return_annotation=ast_node_to_source(node.returns) if node.returns else None,
        )
        yield func_info

        nested_context = NestedContext(parent_function=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from self.visit(child, nested_context)

    def _visit_class_def(
        self, node: ast.ClassDef, context: FunctionContext
    ) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
        """Handle ClassDef nodes."""
        class_context = ClassContext(class_name=node.name, parent_context=context)
        for child in node.body:
            yield from self.visit(child, class_context)


def parse_python_file(file_path: Path) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Parse a Python file and stream all function definitions.

    Args:
        file_path: The path to the Python file.

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the file.
    """
    with open(file_path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
        source_code = f.read()
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=str(file_path))
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=file_path.stem)
    visitor = _FunctionVisitor()
    yield from visitor.visit(tree, module_context)


def parse_python_source(
    source_code: str, module_name: str = "<string>"
) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Parse a Python source string and stream all function definitions.

    Args:
        source_code: The Python code to parse.
        module_name: The name to associate with the module.

    Yields:
        FunctionInfo objects for all functions in the code.
    """
    tree = ast.parse(source_code, filename=module_name)
    module_context = ModuleContext(module_name=module_name)
    visitor = _FunctionVisitor()
    yield from visitor.visit(tree, module_context)


def filter_by_context(
    context_type: type, functions: Iterator[FunctionInfo]
) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Filter functions by their context type (e.g., ClassContext).

    Args:
        context_type: The context class to filter by (e.g., ClassContext).
        functions: An iterator of FunctionInfo objects to filter.

    Yields:
        The functions that match the context type.
    """
    yield from (f for f in functions if isinstance(f.context, context_type))


def filter_by_decorator(
    decorator_name: str, functions: Iterator[FunctionInfo]
) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Filter functions that have a specific decorator.

    Args:
        decorator_name: The name of the decorator to search for.
        functions: An iterator of FunctionInfo objects to filter.

    Yields:
        The functions that have the specified decorator.
    """
    yield from (
        f for f in functions if any(d.name == decorator_name for d in f.decorators)
    )


def get_function_names(functions: Iterator[FunctionInfo]) -> Iterator[str]:
    """
    Extract just the names from a sequence of functions.

    Args:
        functions: An iterator of FunctionInfo objects.

    Yields:
        The function name strings.
    """
    yield from (f.name for f in functions)


def get_async_functions(functions: Iterator[FunctionInfo]) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Filter for and return only the asynchronous functions.

    Args:
        functions: An iterator of FunctionInfo objects.

    Yields:
        The async functions.
    """
    yield from (f for f in functions if f.is_async)


def get_methods(functions: Iterator[FunctionInfo]) -> Iterator[FunctionInfo]:
    """
    Get all functions defined within a class context (methods).

    Args:
        functions: An iterator of FunctionInfo objects.

    Yields:
        The functions defined in a ClassContext.
    """
    yield from filter_by_context(ClassContext, functions)


def format_function_signature(func: FunctionInfo) -> str:
    """
    Format a function's signature into a human-readable string.

    This function correctly handles positional-only, keyword-only, and
    variadic parameters.

    Args:
        func: The FunctionInfo object to format.

    Returns:
        A string representing the function's signature.
    """
    def format_param(p: Parameter) -> str:
        """Formats a single parameter object into a string."""
        res = p.name
        if p.annotation:
            res += f": {p.annotation}"
        if p.default is not None:
            res += f" = {p.default}"
        return res

    parts = []
    pos_only = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_ONLY
    ]
    pos_or_kw = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.POSITIONAL_OR_KEYWORD
    ]
    kw_only = [
        format_param(p)
        for p in func.parameters
        if p.kind == ParameterKind.KEYWORD_ONLY
    ]
    var_pos = next(
        (f"*{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_POSITIONAL),
        None,
    )
    var_kw = next(
        (f"**{p.name}" for p in func.parameters if p.kind == ParameterKind.VAR_KEYWORD),
        None,
    )

    if pos_only:
        parts.append(", ".join(pos_only))
        parts.append("/")
    if pos_or_kw:
        parts.append(", ".join(pos_or_kw))
    if var_pos:
        parts.append(var_pos)
    elif kw_only:
        parts.append("*")
    if kw_only:
        parts.append(", ".join(kw_only))
    if var_kw:
        parts.append(var_kw)

    params_str = ", ".join(part for part in parts if part)
    async_prefix = "async " if func.is_async else ""
    return_suffix = f" -> {func.return_annotation}" if func.return_annotation else ""
    return f"{async_prefix}def {func.name}({params_str}){return_suffix}"
